div.p: I73/9283, unit 750, VPRS 44/P inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Annotated by M: 'Answ 29/4/73 F.v.M.'. Letter not found. See also M to J. Casey, 22 May 1873 (in this edition as 73-05-22r).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Vic. P.O. added in pencil in an unknown hand.

div.p: I am instructed by the Trustees of the Darraweit-guim Cemetery to solicit you on their behalf for a small collection of young trees of a hardy nature to plant in the Cemetery as the rabbits have destroyed a considerable number of those received from you on the last & the previous year. The Trustees intend to protect them this year by enclosing them around with baskets or close fencing, until they grow to a sufficient height to withstand the ravages of those destructive animals. Should you have a few trees or shrubs for distribution to them, if you would be so good as to state when to come for them you would greatly oblige.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
